info.name: Cheer Up!
info.attribution:
Board layout by ArnoldSmith86 and released to public domain by CC0.

Texts generated by ChatGPT and modified by ArnoldSmith86.

Images generated by Midjourney using these prompts:
  • Library image and card backs: "split image, red angy emoji and blue cheerful emoji, water color painting"
  • -2, -1: "ecstatic emoji on dark blue background, water color painting --ar 2:3"
  • 0: "laughing emoji on blue background, water color painting --ar 2:3"
  • 1-4: "smiling emoji on green background, water color painting --ar 2:3"
  • 5-8: "frowny emoji on yellow background, water color painting --ar 2:3"
  • 9-12: "angry emoji off center on red background, water color painting --ar 2:3"
info.description: Strategically swap and collect cards in your grid to achieve the lowest score and claim victory.
info.ruleText:
üéØ Objective

The goal of Cheer Up! is to have the fewest points by the end of the game. Points are scored based on the values of the cards left in your tableau when a round ends.

üÉè Setup

  1. Players take seats by clicking on one.
  2. Press skip_next so each player receives a 3x4 grid of face-down cards.
  3. Players flip any two cards in their grid face-up at the beginning by clicking them.
  4. The remaining cards form the draw pile in the center with one card turned up beside it.
  5. The player with the most points of their face-up cards begins.

üîÑ Gameplay

  • Turn Overview

    1. Draw: A player must take the top card from either the discard pile or the draw pile.

      • From Discard: The player can swap it with a face-down or face-up card in their grid by dragging it onto the card.
      • From Draw Pile: Flip the topmost card on the draw pile. The player has two options:
        • Swap: Replace any face-up or face-down card in their grid by dragging it there.
        • Discard: Drag the card onto the discard pile and reveal an existing card in their grid by clicking it.

    2. Reveal: If a face-down card was swapped, it's revealed immediately.

    3. End Turn: Play proceeds clockwise.

  • Column Removal

    1. Whenever a column of 3 cards shows the same number for each card, all 3 cards are discarded immediately by dragging them to the discard pile. The player continues with one less column.

üèÅ Ending a Round

  • When one player has all their cards face-up, other players get one last turn to improve their tableau.
  • Finally, all face-down cards are revealed.

üìä Scoring

  • Each player adds up the values of their cards. This sum is always displayed directly beneath or above the card grid.
  • If the player that ended the round does not have the least points, their score for the round gets doubled (can be selected when clicking skip_next).
  • The score from each round is added to the total when clicking skip_next, and the game continues.
  • The player, that ended the previous round, begins the next one by clickingskip_next. After the first round, no two cards are flipped at the beginning.

üèÜ Ending the Game

  • The game ends when a player reaches or exceeds 100 points.
  • The player with the lowest score at this point wins.
  • Press restart_alt to start a new game.

üòÉ Have Fun!

Remember, Cheer Up! is as much about luck as it is strategy. Adapt your tactics based on your cards and enjoy the game!

fields.text: This will start a new game by resetting all scores to 0.
This will add the current score to the total and reshuffle for the next round.
